Title: Relates to inheritance by children conceived after the death of a genetic parent
Summary: Relates to inheritance by children conceived after the death of a genetic parent; provides that a genetic child is a distributee of his or her genetic parent if, absent clear and convincing evidence of a contrary intention of the deceased genetic parent, it is established that the person giving birth to the child is the surviving spouse of the genetic parent; the genetic material was collected after the genetic parent's death; and at the time of the genetic parent's death no divorce proceeding was pending.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the estates, powers and trusts law, in relation to inheritance by children conceived after the death of a genetic parent
